1. Read File
You are given a file named "input.txt". Read and print all of its contents as a sequence of bytes (the binary representation of the ASCII code for each character) separated by a single space. 

Examples:

Input 1:
On January 1 , 1533 , Michael Angelo, then fifty-seven years old, writes

Output 1:
1001111 1101110 100000 1001010 1100001 1101110 1110101 1100001 1110010 1111001 100000 110001 100000 101100 100000 110001 110101 110011 110011 100000 101100 100000 1001101 1101001 1100011 1101000 1100001 1100101 1101100 100000 1000001 1101110 1100111 1100101 1101100 1101111 101100 100000 1110100 1101000 1100101 1101110 100000 1100110 1101001 1100110 1110100 1111001 101101 1110011 1100101 1110110 1100101 1101110 100000 1111001 1100101 1100001 1110010 1110011 100000 1101111 1101100 1100100 101100 100000 1110111 1110010 1101001 1110100 1100101 1110011

Input 2:
Two households, both alike in dignity,
In fair Verona, where we lay our scene

Output 2:
1010100 1110111 1101111 100000 1101000 1101111 1110101 1110011 1100101 1101000 1101111 1101100 1100100 1110011 101100 100000 1100010 1101111 1110100 1101000 100000 1100001 1101100 1101001 1101011 1100101 100000 1101001 1101110 100000 1100100 1101001 1100111 1101110 1101001 1110100 1111001 101100 1101 1010 1001001 1101110 100000 1100110 1100001 1101001 1110010 100000 1010110 1100101 1110010 1101111 1101110 1100001 101100 100000 1110111 1101000 1100101 1110010 1100101 100000 1110111 1100101 100000 1101100 1100001 1111001 100000 1101111 1110101 1110010 100000 1110011 1100011 1100101 1101110 1100101
